intro: Despretzia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Despretzia mexicana is often found in desert and scrubland habitats, playing a role in local ecosystems.
